But still i'm a rap person :) the kind from home (U.S)
now this goes out to all who click these links. It doesnt matter what he says i just want ppl to listen to it.

item.title: Rap Fans?
item.dc:creator: @Songoty Songoty
item.description:
@Songoty wrote:

Im going to put down some good parts of lyrics of good songs, and shit poor songs.

  1. 2pac- Pain
What else could i do, i had to feed my fuckin family, what else could i do, but be a thug, out slangin with the hommies, fuck hangin with the fonnies in the club, got my mind on danger, never been a stranger to homicide, my cities full of gangbangers and drive by's, why do we die at such an early age, he was so young, but still a victim of the 12 guage
that is good stuff right there. now, compare that to this song by 50 cent, called heat
If there's beef, cock it and dump it, the drama really means nothin To me I'll ride by and blow ya brains out
It seems to me that rappers today, talk about killing people. People did that back in the day of pac too, but today there more 'open' about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Rap Fans?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

TBH, Rap has to be the only genre where all the artists have met at some point. I always like it when rappers mention other rappers, as a sign of respect or just to dis them. There is alot of rap that is complete shit. But there is also alot that is really good.

Read full topic

item.title: Rap Fans?
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“ThugLife, post:34, topic:154372”]Tupac was shot in 1994 5 times, once in the head twice in the ‘groin’ area and once through his hand that hit an artery in his waist and somewhere else that i can’t remember =, then again in 1996 that punctured his lung that was later removed.

Even still, getting shot is nothing to be bragging about, yeah its fine if your using it to get back at the people who shot you ‘5 shots couldn’t drop me, i took it n smiled’.
Rap started off as, a ‘who is better’ game, like in the rap battles, you would big yourself up, put on this big hard attitude to try and intimidate your opponent and was never meant to be anything more than just rapping against each other.

Oh and before ANY of you say ‘tupac was killed over some rap shit’, i can tell you now, THAT IS NOT THE REASON.
Tupac was killed because, yeah he had a big mouth, someone trys to do something to him he will get up and make noise, someone got sick of him mouthing off to people and killed him, simple as that, or it could of just been a pay back from that night in vegas when he had that fight with that crip?.

In my opinion, from how i see it biggie was killed in revenge of tupac, because at the time there was loads of speculation going around that it was him who hired to have him shot, although i do not believe this one bit, biggie was not that type of guy.

A theory that i have believed in for quite a long while though is that suge knight had them both killed, because before tupac died, Suge knight owed tupac millions, in royalties and for loads more, and as tupac was in the planning stages of his new record label ‘makaveli records’ tupac would obviously be looking for his money when he left death row, Suge was not prepared to pay him back and killed him, and there is the fact that if tupac went independent, he would of been unstoppable, since he already was at the time at the top of the rap/hip-hop scene and had such a large influence on people, he would of been making millions more than Death row records, and be virtually unstoppable, since he could do what he wanted as he would not be under management.

Biggie was just a victim to all the aftermath of tupacs killing, thats what i believe in anyway.[/quote]

There was a series of killings (more than usual) between Bloods and Crips after Tupac and Notorious B.I.G. were killed. If their deaths can affect west coast gangsters why couldn’t it affect other people? I agree with you, Biggie was killed as a sort of “revenge” killing for Tupac. It’s sad and really doesn’t put a good light on rap as a music but it’s what probably happened.

Read full topic

item.title: Rap Fans?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Tupac was shot in 1994 5 times, once in the head twice in the ‘groin’ area and once through his hand that hit an artery in his waist and somewhere else that i can’t remember =, then again in 1996 that punctured his lung that was later removed.

Even still, getting shot is nothing to be bragging about, yeah its fine if your using it to get back at the people who shot you ‘5 shots couldn’t drop me, i took it n smiled’.
Rap started off as, a ‘who is better’ game, like in the rap battles, you would big yourself up, put on this big hard attitude to try and intimidate your opponent and was never meant to be anything more than just rapping against each other.

Oh and before ANY of you say ‘tupac was killed over some rap shit’, i can tell you now, THAT IS NOT THE REASON.
Tupac was killed because, yeah he had a big mouth, someone trys to do something to him he will get up and make noise, someone got sick of him mouthing off to people and killed him, simple as that, or it could of just been a pay back from that night in vegas when he had that fight with that crip?.

In my opinion, from how i see it biggie was killed in revenge of tupac, because at the time there was loads of speculation going around that it was him who hired to have him shot, although i do not believe this one bit, biggie was not that type of guy.

A theory that i have believed in for quite a long while though is that suge knight had them both killed, because before tupac died, Suge knight owed tupac millions, in royalties and for loads more, and as tupac was in the planning stages of his new record label ‘makaveli records’ tupac would obviously be looking for his money when he left death row, Suge was not prepared to pay him back and killed him, and there is the fact that if tupac went independent, he would of been unstoppable, since he already was at the time at the top of the rap/hip-hop scene and had such a large influence on people, he would of been making millions more than Death row records, and be virtually unstoppable, since he could do what he wanted as he would not be under management.

Biggie was just a victim to all the aftermath of tupacs killing, thats what i believe in anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Rap Fans?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“llib, post:32, topic:154372”][quote author=Dregen link=topic=210860.msg1846877#msg1846877 date=1193464712]
Also, another thing that bothers me about rap is that it’s mostly about popularity, money, and/or sex. That’s what really makes it annoying.
[/quote]

Wow. Wake up and look at the world around you. Rap isn’t the only genre of music with sex and money in it. Although it does have generally more of it (at least the current rap songs do). Not saying I’m a fan of rap, because I’m not. At least not a fan of “today’s rap.”

Don’t tell me you’ve never heard of the phrase:

For sex, drugs, and Rock n’ Roll! :D[/quote]

And its continuation - concentrate on the second, and you’ll often find that the other two didn’t actually happen!

Read full topic
